main event: An observation of a light streak entering the atmosphere was reported on 3 October 1962 at Buck Island, Caribbean.
interesting points: The object was observed from the hills above Christiansted at a 45-degree angle., The sighting lasted about 5 seconds and was not a flare., The object was described as a white streak, which suggests it was likely a meteor., The report included various types of radar data information., The sighting involved one object observed in a straight course.
witness description: observer from the hills above Christiansted
